Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= to try to win a favorable attitude from someone else; ◄ by approaching that person in a very humble way
literally: to bend (one's) ear; hence: = action by which humans or deities make a conscious effort to listen to what (other) humans say
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= state in which someone is surrounded on all sides

= rope tied into a noose, attached to the other end to a bent bough or small tree that springs upright and tightens the noose around the victim when the trap is sprung; ► used for hunting animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= process by which humans or animals stop living
= a state in which humans experience extreme anxiety, ◄ as a result of difficult circumstances, as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment
literally: (an event) finds (people); = process by which humans eventually undergo a certain event, ◄ as if that event had been searching for them
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= process by which humans experience sorrow and suffering
literally: (an event) finds (people); = process by which humans eventually undergo a certain event, ◄ as if that event had been searching for them
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= marker introducing a very humble request
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which deities are favorably disposed to someone, or of experiencing an emotion of compassion towards other people, and acting accordingly
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

Node.gloss: to be merciful|to have mercy (on someone)|to have compassion (on someone)
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities feel compassion for other, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action: a person who feels compassion may forgive an offence, refrain from aggression and/or punishment, or revoke punishment

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
= person who is easily influenced by other people, ideas or one's own passions; ◄ because of his/her lack of wisdom and experience
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= process by which an individual or group of people is reduced to a state of insignificance and becomes powerless to help oneself ◄ due to difficult circumstances such as poverty, sickness, and warfare
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
literally: to turn (back) to (an activity); hence: = action by which humans engage in an activity; in most cases this is an activity in which they were engaged before
literally: a resting place; hence: = a state of mind in which humans find relief after a time of distress
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans or deities act towards a person in a way that has consequences and can result either in retribution or a reward
= causative action by which deities bring humans out of a dangerous situation

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= process by which humans or animals stop living

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= fluid appearing in the eye; ≈ primarily associated with grief and mourning

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: foot, here used metonymically to denote the entire person or animal owning it; hence: = a human being or animal with focus on the activities for which they use their feet
= action by which someone strikes one's foot against something while walking or running, causing this person to stagger or fall; ≈ possibly a euphemism for death
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= state in which humans and deities are alive and well, ◄ which, for humans, requires the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

Node.gloss: to have faith|to keep faith|to trust|to believe
Node.definition: = state in which humans are confident with regard to another person or deity, which means that this person or deity does only speak the truth but is also faithful, and willing and able to help

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

Node.gloss: to be afflicted|to be bothered|to be daunted
Node.definition: literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= process by which humans or animals are overcome by a sudden uncontrollable fear or anxiety resulting in a frenzied hurry to run away
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= action by which a human or deity says or reveals something that is not true

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to repay|to pay back|to punish|to reward
Node.definition: literally: to send back (to someone); hence: = causative process by which humans or deities case (other) humans or deities to receive the appropriate return for their actions, which can be either good or bad
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans or deities act towards other humans or deities in a way that has consequences and can result either in retribution or a reward
= small, bowl shaped container ► used for drinking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote one's portion in life, received from God
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success

Node.gloss: to take up|to lift up|to carry
Node.definition: literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans take hold of objects with their hands, with the intention of holding them or bringing them to another location
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= action by which humans make a solemn promise to a deity, ► which signals a commitment to perform a certain act or behave in a specific way, usually in return for a blessing from the deity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: precious; hence: = state in which a condition or activity is highly appreciated or considered of high significance

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= process by which humans or animals stop living

= someone who practices חֶסֶד, who is committed towards fulfilling his/her obligations; these may be obligations defined within the context of a covenant or agreement, or moral obligations to do well to someone who did well to you before
= marker introducing a very humble request
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= woman who is the legal property of someone else; either married or eligible for marriage; her children belong to the person who owns her; ≈ because of this an אָמָה appears to have a somewhat higher status than a שִׁפְחָה even though both terms are sometimes used interchangeably
literally: to loose (someone's) bonds; hence: = causative action by which deities save humans from danger, ◄ as if by releasing them from the trap in which they were caught
= material used to tie objects together or to tie animals or humans; ≈ associated with power and control over something or someone else

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
literally: thanksgiving; hence: = a sacrifice offered as a token of thankfulness
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= action by which humans make a solemn promise to a deity, ► which signals a commitment to perform a certain act or behave in a specific way, usually in return for a blessing from the deity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= area enclosed by walls or buildings

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= action by which humans or divine beings express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to (other) humans or deities about who they are and what they do
= short form of יהוה (יהוה) only found in poetic texts
